content: This American author penned the classic novels 'The Adventures of Tom Sawyer' and its sequel, 'Adventures of Huckleberry Finn', often called "the Great American Novel".

Mark Twain, whose real name was Samuel Langhorne Clemens, is indeed the renowned American author who wrote "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" and its sequel, "Adventures of Huckleberry Finn." "Adventures of Huckleberry Finn" is often regarded as one of the greatest works of American literature and has earned the title "the Great American Novel." Twain's works are celebrated for their wit, satire, and deep insights into human nature and society, particularly during the 19th century in the United States.
